page.title: 12ROOKERY FARM, COVENTRY.
page.content: { Computerised dairy farm,}240 acres. Herd of 200 friesian cows, plus 40 one and two year olds. Breeding by A.I. backed up by bringing in a Hereford bull. Automatically after every milking the milk yield from each cow is recorded and stored in the computer for future reference. Each cow has a number tag and a collar with a metal disc to operate the food control switch. Cows are fed in the{herringbone}milking parlour according to milk yield. In winter while kept inside they are again control fed.{Annual yield}of milk is 6000 litres per cow,average price paid to the farmer 14p per litre.200 acres, 83% is used for ley grass. 40 acres, 17% for peas for silage. Silage made per annum 20.5th. tons.The farmer employs a herdsman and one farm labourer to operate machinery
